result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brady Michael Rode

records.addlTxt: Arrangements made for def to appear by Zoom from Racine Youthful Correctional for hearing on 11-30-22

Defendant Brady Michael Rode appeared by video.  Attorney Daryl W Laatsch in court for Brady Michael Rode. Victim present.  Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def consents to appear by video.   Counsel has conference scheduled w/def for tomorrow. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing; def to appear by video.
Hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Arrangements made for def to appear by Zoom from Racine Youthful Correctional for hearing on 10-20-22

Defendant Brady Michael Rode not in court.  Attorney Daryl W Laatsch in court for Brady Michael Rode.  Prosecuting attorney Elizabeth A Longo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def was to appear by video, however, did not appear due to electronic issues.  Court adj.
Arrangements made for def to appear by Zoom from Racine Youthful Offender Correctional for hearing on 9-12-22.

Defendant Brady Michael Rode not in court.  Attorney Gordon R Leech in court for Brady Michael Rode.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson in court for the State of Wisconsin. Def was to appear by video, however, was in segregation.  Court adj.
Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Arrangements made for def to appear by Zoom from Racine Youthful Offender Correctional for hearing on 8-22-22.
No contact with A.M.R. or any females under 18 years.
SPD notified via email of def's request to have SPD represent; bond, notice and complaint faxed to def at Racine Youthful Offender Correctional.
No contact with AMR or any females under 18 years (Bond, NOH for 8/22/22, and Complaint faxed to Racine Youthful Off Corr to have bond signed and returned)

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brady Michael Rode appeared by video, in custody. Def consents to appearing by video.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found. Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights. Def referred to SPD.  Court sets $5000 signature bond.  Def waives time limits on preliminary hearing; Court accepts.  Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing and to appear w/an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Arrangements made for def to appear by Zoom from Racine Youthful Correctional Facility for hearing on 8-1-22.
Initial appearance on August 1, 2022 at 08:15 am.
